data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Update the launch file to work with modern joy. (#52)

It should use "device_id" (not "dev") as the parameter,
and the parameter should be a number, not a path (this is
effectively the SDL device number, which is cross-platform).

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: aravindsrj
data.message:
Make Parameters dynamic (#16)

* Make parameters dynamic

That is, make it so that we can change the parameters at runtime.
There are two loops; the first one does type checking to ensure
that the new values are all of the correct type; if any of them fails,
none of the parameters are updated.  The second loop actually
does the assignment to the internal implementation, so the values
will be used the next time a joy message comes in.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Get some basic tests running (#10)

* Add some basic testing

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

* Fix one last flake8 violation

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

* Call cppcheck explicitly to specify LANGUAGE

* Make all of the tests work with ROS 2

Two tests are disabled while we decided how to handle the difference in
behavior.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

* Add a missing test dependency

* Update tests to reflect new ROS 2 turbo behavior

* Add another test dependency

* Stop running the default cppcheck

* Make the test class names unique

* Try re-arranging the ament_cppcheck call

* Give up on getting cppcheck running with special args

* Remove unnecessary shebang.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Change test_joy_twist.py to not have executable bits.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* More test fixes.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

Changelog.

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix parameters so things actually work in Dashing. (#9)

This change ensures that we declare parameters before trying
to use them; otherwise, "get_parameters" will fail on startup.
To use this new system, we also slightly change how we deal
with axes that are unassigned; instead of having no parameter,
we now declare the parameter with the mapping set to -1 (an
invalid number).  Finally, we fix up a compiler warning when
printing an int64.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Changelog.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Add in the ability to control via parameters (#8)

* Rewrite TeleopTwistJoy to inherit from Node.

This is the recommended way to do it, and will make adding
parameter events more straightforward.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Make teleop_twist_joy closer to upstream.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Rewrite parameter stuff to get the parameters using ROS 2 APIs.

This allows the node to be configurable like the ROS 1 version
was.  This also incorporates changes from
https://github.com/ros-teleop/teleop_twist_joy/pull/30, which
ensures that the node does not crash when invalid joystick
messages are published.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Switch to int64_t for integers.

This is because parameters in ROS 2 only come in int64_t
flavors, and MSVC complains about a loss of precision.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Make parameter unambiguous.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Change to ament_cmake to make Windows happy.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>
